reviews.text: I stayed here with my daughter for a softball tournament this weekend. We travel every weekend from the end of April through mid August and Hampton has alwyas been my hotel of choice. First, I paid almost $50 more a night at this Hampton than I ever had, and I am a Gold member of Hilton. The location of this hotel is great, walking distance to anything you need. I called for towels on the first noght (only had 2 and we had used them after coming from the ball diamonds the first time) and was told they could not bring them to me but I could come get them. 7 people in line at the desk and no clerk, so I waited and when she finally returned I was told no towels, sorry maybe tomorrow.
reviews.title: Average at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast was very inadequate for the number of guests at this hotel. They ran out of everything both days so we had to go get her breakfast on the way to the fields. I understand they were full but when you run a business, you know how many guests you will have (hotel had been full for weeks) and you should plan accordingly. So for $50 extra a night, we still had to buy breakfast because they did not refill the food often enough and we couldnt wait any longer.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, surprised it was Pet Friendly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will not say this hotel was overly dirty but average at best on cleanliness...the hallways needed cleaned VERY MUCH...crumbs on the floor in our room when we got there (vaccum had not been run), old style hotel bathrooms , wallpaper was peeling. Nothing horrible but considering I am in a Hampton at a minimun of 16 weekends a year this particular hotel needs to step it up and be prepared to provide service to the number of guests that are staying as well as clean up a little. There are several big name hotels close to this one (Homewood, Holiday Inn, Hilton Garden Inn) so for the money I would definitely say keep shopping.
reviews.title: Especially nice Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the second part of our trip to Indianapolis and Ohio, we stayed at the Hampton Inn. It was reasonably priced and very very nice. The dogs were welcome without any further charge. (Some Hilton properties charge an extra $100 non refundable.) The beds were comfortable and it would have been great to stay there another night, but we had to get home.
reviews.title: Quality Service!

reviews.text: Stayed here recently for 3 days while remodeling was done at home. Great stay! We have stayed at many, many Hampton Inns over the years, but this one was really nice......spotlessly clean, well appointed room, good bed, attentive service and very nice breakfast. All in all a great value. Only possible negative was that the room's heater/AC was a bit loud. Other than that.....wonderful hotel.
reviews.title: Clean and comfortable

reviews.text: This is a bit more off the highway than some of the others in the area, but very well kept, very friendly staff, and perfect for those travelling with a dog. Breakfast had plenty of options and was all fresh.
reviews.title: very nice and dog friendly

reviews.text: Was visiting a friend and the accomodations, staff, continental breakfast, were all excellent.
reviews.title: Excellent and would recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is one of the nicest Hotels my wife and I have stayed at. The people at the front deck were very friendly and went above that you would expect at check-in. The place was spotless, both in the lobby the pool area and our room. The breakfast bar was better then average and they actually had regular size donuts. The hotel is very close to all kinds of shopping, but you need a car to get to it.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay!!!

reviews.text: The hotel seemed a bit run down and a bit updated at the same time. I stay in Hampton inns fairly regularly and this one was not as nice as most. The carpet in my room had a few stains.
reviews.title: Adequate...

reviews.text: It looked like the owner did the most recent "corporate" updates that were required and no more. Bedding, sofa in the room, signage; all updated. Furniture, wall coverings and art work; not updated.
reviews.title: Great Breakfast

reviews.text: We stayed here for business. It was a nicely kept property. The breakfast was nice, but the staff was really wonderful. Pleasant, friendly, and eager to please.
reviews.title: nice place

reviews.text: Excellent front desk, comfortable beds, clean room, good breakfast, very close to shopping and restaurants. Will definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay

reviews.text: I stayed here on a business trip and it fit the bill perfectly. Clean, quiet, and a restaurant in walking distance. Breakfast is included and is decent for a buffet set-up. I would go back here.
reviews.title: quiet comfort

reviews.text: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Eastgate March 3. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. There was a large soccer group staying there also. The young men were nice, polite, and quiet. The was a few flubs when we first checked in. The first room we were assigned was a queen double. We had reserved a king. We were moved into a king suite that the air conditioner did not work. When we contacted the front desk, we were given an up grade for our troubles. The upgrade was very spacious and had a jetted tub. Linens were nice and clean. Bathroom was very clean. Hallways were nice and quiet. Carpets was clean in all three rooms we were in. We skipped breakfast because the dinning area was filled with hungry, but nice, soccer players. This was a family trip and this hotel was chosen because our son had to bring his dog.
reviews.title: Would stay there again.

reviews.text: The facility and breakfast area are OK, although below the usual Hampton Inn.
reviews.title: Dog in breakfast area, barefoot pajamied grandpa also

reviews.text: One of the cleanest hotel rooms I've been in. Breakfast was good with lots of choices....hot oatmeal with toppings, waffles, eggs, french toast sticks, sausage, and all the usual cold choices. Ladies were working hard to keep things stocked and it seemed packed. Also nice cookies available at the front desk 24 hrs. a day.
reviews.title: Super clean and good breakfast

reviews.text: It was hard to find, tucked behind some retail. We did have a registration for a microwave/fridge room and the room we were assigned did not have these items but it was late and we didn't bother going down asking for a change. Also was suprised the front desk had no brochures on things to do around the area when our original plans fell through. Stopped at nearby Holiday Inn which had a very helpful front desk with lots of ideas and maps.
reviews.title: Stay here if you're on the east side

reviews.text: You'd never expect it from seeing it tucked in behind a Starbucks and Meijer but the Hampton Inn in Eastgate is the place to stay if you're on the east side of Cincinnati. It doesn't have bells and whistles but it has what a hotel needs, clean rooms with comfortable beds. Plus, being back away from the highway it's very peaceful and a place to unwind. Right in the middle of Eastgate it's also next to all sorts of restaurants and the Eastgate mall.
reviews.title: A great little find.

reviews.text: This hotel is outside of Cincinnati. It takes about 20 minutes to travel to The Great American Ball Park. A Meijers is conveniently located next to it. It is just a couple minutes from the East Gate Shopping Mall. The staff is very friendly and the hotel is very clean. The oatmeal served at breakfast is very good. We are nonsmokers and ended up having to stay in a smoking room because all others were booked, and we had no reservations. The room was really clean, and although you could tell the room had been smoked in, the smell was manageable. We ended up staying 2 nights. We will most likely be returning to this hotel on our future trips to Cincinnati. We would recommend this hotel to a friend.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: This hotel we have stayed at quite a few times. However the only complaint is that everytime we stay the corp rate is different. We can never depend on this and that can be very dishearting.
reviews.title: Regular visitor......
